etymologies: 1950s: from the initial letters of Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation + -arin on the pattern of coumarin

definitions: a water-soluble compound with anticoagulant properties, used as a rat poison and in the treatment of thrombosis.

notes.text: A coumarin derivative; chemical formula: C₁₉H₁₆O₄

shortDefinitions: water-soluble compound with anticoagulant properties, used as rat poison and in treatment of thrombosis
